entry.title: üï∏ HTML (HyperText Markup Language) 2018
entry.content:
HTMLRelat√≠ve eg√©szen sok id≈ët t√∂lt√∂ttem m√°r el k√ºl√∂nb√∂z≈ë HTML-alap√∫ weboldal √∂tletek tervezget√©s√©vel √∫gy, hogy sosem olvastam m√©g el egyetlenegy aktu√°lis HTML verzi√≥ teljes dokument√°ci√≥j√°t sem az elej√©t≈ël a v√©g√©ig, √©s √≠gy sajnos sosem tudtam m√©g rendesen sem elm√©lyedni a t√©m√°ban.

Most, amikor √©pp ezzel az √∫j oldallal kis√©rleteztem, arra gondoltam, hogyha egyszer valamikor abbahagyom majd a TSM-mel ( Spectrum Protect, aka: Tivoli Storage Manager, ADSTAR Distributed Storage Manager, ADSM) val√≥ munk√°imat, akkor lehet, hogy tal√°n ez lenne az a k√∂vetkez≈ë t√©ma / ter√ºlet, amit sz√≠vesen csin√°ln√©k majd helyette.

A sok ‚Äúgondolkod√°s‚Äù k√∂zben / el≈ëtt, eg√©szen a kezdetekkor m√°r lementettem p√°r .html oldalt, amiben mind tal√°ltam valami nekem tetsz≈ë vagy √©ppen valami nekem nem tetsz≈ë dolgot √©s ham√°r √∂sszeraktam ezt az oldalt err≈ël a t√©m√°r√≥l, akkor azonnnal adta mag√°t, hogy itt lesz ezent√∫l ezenknek a r√©gen lementett k√©peknek a v√©gleges hely√ºk. Lehet, hogy egyszer azt kis le√≠rom majd, hogy melyikr≈ël mit gondolok, de nem most.

plastik.hu saved in 2010.

index.hu saved in 2012.

google.com saved in 2012.

adobe.com saved in 2012.

nol.hu saved in 2012.

microsoft.com saved in 2012.

origo.hu saved in 2012.

cnn.com saved in 2012.

ibm.com saved in 2010.

news_template.htm saved in 2010.

Tartalom saved in 2010.

Az √∫j gazdas√°g r√©gi szab√°lya saved in 2010.

google.hu saved in 2017.


Egy picit tov√°bb visszatekerve m√©g az id≈ë kerek√©t, a lementett k√©peken k√≠v√ºl, a saj√°t √∂tletekb≈ël √©s kis√©rletezget√©sekb≈ël a k√∂vetkez≈ë nekem fontos oldalak maradtak fenn:

  1. fleischmann.hu saved in 2010.

    geocities.com/gfleischmann/ saved in 2004.

    Az els≈ë saj√°t weboldalam (~1997-b≈ël) m√©g a GeoCities1 ingyenes szolg√°ltat√°s√°ra √©p√ºlt √©s amit most l√°tok csak, hogy ennek a nyomai egy lelkes internetes csoportnak (OoCities2) k√∂sz√∂nhet≈ëen m√©g mindig el√©rhet≈ëek a k√∂vetkez≈ë c√≠men is: www.oocities.org/gfleischmann. √ân, az old.fleischmann.hu/geocities.com oldalon ≈ërz√∂m az utols√≥ √°llapot√°t. Az oldal tan√∫s√°ga alapj√°n, 2003. √©v v√©g√©ig volt ez m√©g szerkesztve.

  2. Egy kisebb sz√ºnet ut√°n valamikor ~2005-t≈ël a k√∂vetez≈ë, m√°r teljesen √∫j form√°j√°ban sz√ºletett √∫jra a weboldalam: fleischmann.hu internetes domain alatt. (K√ºl√∂n k√∂sz√∂net illeti ez√©rt T√≥th Petit (G.A.M.F., Kecskem√©t) a domain n√©v regisztr√°ci√≥√©rt!) Ennek az oldalank az √∫jdons√°ga a fot√≥blogol√°s volt, amihez a statikus oldalkat egy saj√°t k√©sz√≠t√©s≈± perl szkript ‚Äúford√≠tott‚Äù le. Ez az eg√©sz fot√≥blogol√°s eg√©szen 2009 els≈ë negyed√©ig tartott. K√∂zben (~2014-ben) mag√°t az oldalt kiszolg√°l√≥ √©s hosztol√≥ fizikai g√©p (ami√©rt nem gy≈ëz√∂k ugyszint el√©gg√© h√°l√°s lenni Vihari Bal√°zsnak, (Cr√©dit Lyonnais, Budapest)) is megsz≈±nt m√°r. Az√≥ta eg√©szen 2017-ig nem is t√∂rt√©nt m√°r vele tudtommal semmi v√°ltoz√°s eg√©szen pontosan mostan√°ig, amikor is felt√∂lt√∂ttem minden √°ltalam el√©rhet≈ë arch√≠v f√°jlt a GitHub-ra √©s a pages.github.com szolg√°lt√°sra hagytam az oldalak t√©nyleges kiszolg√°l√°s√°t a kor√°bban m√°r eml√≠tett old.fleischmann.hu domain alatt.

  3. gyorgy.fleischmann.hu saved in 2017.

    √âpp amikor ezeket a felt√∂lt√©seket √©s a hozz√°juk kapcsol√≥d√≥ finom√≠t√°sokat csin√°ltam (DNS bejegyz√©sek friss√≠t√©se, r√©gi karakter k√≥dol√°sok jav√≠t√°sa a GitHub-hoz, Google Analytics √∫jra√©leszt√©se) gondoltam arra, hogy mi lenne akkor, ha ide √∫jra k√©sz√≠ten√©k m√°r egy teljesen √∫j oldalt is, az itt adott technik√°kkal (GitHub, jekyll, HTML5, CSS3). Els≈ë k√∂rben a k√∂vetkez≈ëket t≈±ztem ki c√©lul:

    • tudjon majd kezelni sorkiz√°rt sz√∂vegeket √∫gy, hogy dinamikusan kezeljen ezzel egy√ºtt jobbra/balra igaz√≠tott k√©peket vagy sz√∂vegdobozokat is;
    • valahogy lehessen inici√°l√©kat tenni a bekezd√©sek el√©;
    • lehessen termin√°l szer≈± (fekete ablak) p√©ld√°kat beid√©zni;
    • mag√°t√≥l kezeljen forr√°sprogrami p√©ld√°kat sz√©pen sz√≠nezve a szintaxiskiemel√©seket (syntax highlighting);
    • lehessen fot√≥szeteket kezelni √©s legyen hozz√° egy egyszer≈±en haszn√°lhat√≥ teljesk√©perny≈ës fot√≥ megjelen√≠t≈ë;
    • tudjon m√©diaf√°jlokat kezelni: .mp3, .mp4, youtube, vimeo, soundcloud, ‚Ä¶;
    • norm√°lisan kezelje a markdown f√°jl form√°z√≥ lehet≈ës√©geit;
    • a nyomtatott v√°ltozat is √©rtkelhet≈ë kimenetet eredm√©nyezzen;

A meg√°lmodott √©s v√©g√ºl elk√©sz√≠tett megold√°st itt: jekyll tesztoldalam √©s jekyll tesztoldalam2 teszteltem.

Persze lehetne m√©g ezt az eg√©sz diz√°jnt -, ha nevezhetj√ºk ezt egy√°ltal√°n annak - is a v√©gtelens√©gig csiszolgatni, de √©n most itt, ezen a ponton egyel≈ëre abbahagyom, mert eddig okozott a bel√© fektetett munka √∂r√∂m√∂t, boldog√°sgot √©s nem szeren√©m, ha ez a v√©g√©n esetleg m√©g rossz ir√°nyba v√°ltozna meg!

  1. Yahoo! GeoCities a Wikipedi√°n¬†↩

  2. OoCities¬†↩

entry.title: üë®üèª‚Äçüéì CV
entry.content:
FLEISCHMANN Gy√∂rgy ‚Ä¢ nick names: flex, gyurci, FleXoft

@flexoft ‚Ä¢+36 30 979 1403 ‚Ä¢ gyorgy@fleischmann.hu ‚Ä¢ H-1185, Budapest, Ungv√°r utca 33/1., HUNGARY

SUMMARY

Photo by me, 2016.11.11., Minolta Dynax 7D, 50mm

Highly qualified certified systems engineer / architect / consultant with more than 13 years of experience in designing, building and supporting complex Spectrum Protect (aka: Tivoli Storage Manager, TSM, ADSTAR Distributed Storage Manager, ADSM) at the biggest Hungarian companies.

One of the well-known IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect experts / evangelists in Hungary. Enthusiastic member of the Hungarian Tivoli User Group (Hu-TUG). Regular speaker at biannual events in IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect related topics.

Team player and problem-solver with very good communication and interpersonal skills.

FAMILY

more / less

Moh√°cs, Baranya ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

37-14 ‚Ä¢ mother, Zsuzsanna ‚Ä¢
45-na ‚Ä¢ father, Gy√∂rgy ‚Ä¢
57-na ‚Ä¢ stepbrother, Istv√°n ‚Ä¢
70-na ‚Ä¢
74-na ‚Ä¢ wife, Hajnalka ‚Ä¢
01-na ‚Ä¢ Anna ‚Ä¢
05-na ‚Ä¢ Gerg≈ë ‚Ä¢
17-na ‚Ä¢ Andr√°s ‚Ä¢

WORK

more / less

Budapest, Pest ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

15-na ‚Ä¢

System engineer, IBM Spectrum Protect (Tivoli Storage Manager) specialist ‚Ä¢ SCSS Informatikai, Kereskedelmi √©s Szolg√°ltat√≥ Kft., Effective Group Informatika Zrt.
  • Supporting a dozen large IBM TSM, SP customers in Hungary
  • Supporting IBM GPFS, Spectrum Scale cutomers with TSM / SP HSM
  • TSM Symposium, 15 (Dresden)
  • Speaker of IBM, RRC Systems Day (Effective storage usage in backup environments, real implementation experiences), 17
Main projects and references:
  • 7/24 high availability TSM v6, v7, v8 support for:
    • MKB Bank (>3Y): 4 TSM servers on a HP-UX cluster environment with library manager configuration and other 2 TSM servers (IBM AIX) for document archiving systems
    • Generali Biztos√≠t√≥ (>2Y): 2 general TSM servers on Microsoft Windows and other 2 TSM (IBM AIX) servers for document store systems
    • MTVA (>3Y): TSM on a Microsoft Windows cluster, node replication, container pool deduplication environments and TSM on Linux with GPFS filesystems
    • MVMI, NAK(Nemzeti Agr√°rgazdas√°gi Kamara), Di√°khitel, EOS, FGSZ, FPH
04-14 ‚Ä¢

System engineer, IBM Tivoli Storage Manager specialist ‚Ä¢ USER Tan√°csad√≥ Kft., USER Rendszerh√°z Kft. (IBM Tivoli Awards, 12 ‚Ä¢ IBM AAA-level Tivoli Deployment Accreditation, 13)
  • Supporting a dozen large IBM TSM customers in Hungary
  • Participation the biggest IBM TSM related events (IBM C&SI EMEA Technical Academy, 14 (Madrid) ‚Ä¢ IBM Tivoli Technical Academy, 13 (Reading) ‚Ä¢ TSM Symposium, 11 (Dresden))
  • Architect / integrate big IBM TSM configurations
  • Troubleshoot / consult performance, backup, restore issues
  • Member of several IBM TSM API based development
  • Health check, operate, maintain big IBM TSM environments
  • Speaker of VMware Cloud Day (Backing up VMware with IBM technology), 13
Main projects and references:
  • 7/24 high availability TSM v5, v6 support for:
    • MKB Bank (>10Y): 4 TSM servers on a HP-UX cluster environment with library manager configuration and other 2 TSM servers (IBM AIX) for document archiving systems
    • Allianz Biztos√≠t√≥ (>10Y): TSM on a HA AIX environment with library manager configuration and other 2 TSM servers for document store systems
    • Generali Biztos√≠t√≥ (>10Y): 4 general TSM servers on Microsoft Windows for the region and other 2 TSM servers on IBM AIX for document store systems
    • FHB Bank (>2Y): TSM on a AIX HA environment
    • Budapest Bank (>10Y): 2 TSM servers on a HA AIX environment
    • Chello Central Europe (>8Y): biggest TSM based video media archiving environment implementation and support
    • HVB/UniCredit Bank (>10Y): the first v5 ‚Äì> v6 migrated AIX TSM systems on an IBM PureFlex system in the region
  • TSM v5 -> v6 migration (TSM DB > 300GB) (OEP, UniCredit Bank, Generali Biztos√≠t√≥, MKB Bank)
  • v6 TSM based backup solutions for IBM PureFlex based environments and support (iCell, NISZ)
  • TSM v5 -> v6 migration consultation at HSBC Turkey (Istanbul)
  • Dealt with IBM SoftLayer fundamentals (Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS))
01-03 ‚Ä¢

Network / IBM Lotus Notes / Domino administrator ‚Ä¢ Schneider Electric Hung√°ria Villamoss√°gi Rt.
  • IBM Lotus Notes administrator (450 users; Austria, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Croatia, Yugoslavia) and developer
  • operating the whole network
  • work in S.A.P. R3 environment (COMPAQ/Digital, True64 UNIX)
  • organised and successfully started the new logistics center of Schneider Electric Hung√°ria Villamoss√°gi Rt. in Harbor Park (Frame Relay connection to the center, phone network, computer network, wireless phone (DECT), wireless network (based on Cisco Aironet 340, 350 series), Novell Netware, ...)
  • working with the following systems and equipments: CheckPoint firewall, Netscape iPlanet Web server, Netscape CMS server, Netscape Proxy server, Novell Netware 5.x, Intel Shiva + Radius, Nortel network equipments (switches, routers, hubs), ntp, ...
  • prepared: SMS gateway (Linux + perl + Nokia 6210), webcamera (Linux + V4L + bttv)
  • started the intranet in Hungary (based on IBM Lotus Notes, WIB)
98-01 ‚Ä¢

Office Automation Officer ‚Ä¢ Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale Hung√°ria Bank Inc.
  • we built up the whole information system of this new bank (with two of my colleagues) from the ground
  • Lotus Notes administrator and developer
  • working with GIRO, SWIFT and the local accounting system
  • installing and supporting SogeCash (MultiCash based) remote bank system
97-98 ‚Ä¢

EDP assistent ‚Ä¢ Cr√©dit Lyonnais Bank Hungary Inc.
  • learning to use and operate the new systems (HP-UX, HP PCs, Microsoft WindowsNT network, SQL, TCP/IP)
  • worked with GIRO, SWIFT, Lotus Notes and the local accounting system

Moh√°cs, Baranya ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

91-97 ‚Ä¢

System engineer ‚Ä¢ Fibreboard Factory (M.O.F.A.) Inc.
  • learned to use i8048 and i8051 microcontrollers
  • December 1991 - August 1992 programmer assistant, computer technology collaborator
  • learned to use the local network, programmed in C language
  • March 1994 - March 1997 computer technology organizer

  • formed new concepts in the information technology system of the company, established the e-mail system and the DIAL-IN accessibility of the network, developed ONLINE systems and established these systems on the existing network
  • software legalization
  • established and maintained several Novell NetWare based networks in Moh√°cs city

EDUCATION

Kecskem√©t, B√°cs-Kiskun ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

Technical College of Machine Industry and Automation (G.A.M.F.) ‚Ä¢ specialization: computer technology

Moh√°cs, Baranya ‚Ä¢ HUNGARY

84-88 ‚Ä¢

Kisfaludy K√°roly Secondary School ‚Ä¢ faculties: mathematics, physics

TECHNICAL SKILLS

Programming languages

Objective-C (applications with Core Location framework, 13 and BLE, 17) ‚Ä¢ C (kernel mode device driver on Linux, TSM API) ‚Ä¢ 80x86 assembly (direct IPX protocol programming) ‚Ä¢ ATMEL AVR assembly, C (GSM based home automation, 09) ‚Ä¢ Epson S1C88 assembly (code breaker game, 04) ‚Ä¢ CA Clipper ‚Ä¢ DataFlex ‚Ä¢ perl (tsmadm.pl, 13) ‚Ä¢ awk ‚Ä¢ UNIX shell ‚Ä¢ Psion OPL (PhotoPal, 01) ‚Ä¢ Lotus Formula ‚Ä¢ Lotus Script (incident log system) ‚Ä¢ JavaScript

Hardware

IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect related

Daily TSM administration and 7/24 support for banks, insurance companies, broadcasting companies and state sector ‚Ä¢ Co-author of the tsmadmin.com blog ‚Ä¢ Founder of the tsmadm.pl free IBM TSM administration tool ‚Ä¢ The person who opens / closes the most tickets (IBM PMR, Problem Management Report) each year in Hungary ‚Ä¢ Took IBM TSM / Spectrum Protect (implementation, operation, administration, advanced administration) trainings (>30, on behalf of IBM, IQSOFT - John Bryce Oktat√≥k√∂zpont Kft. and Training 360 Kft.)

Professional Certifications

  • Veeam Technical Sales Professional (VMTSP) - Veeam Availability Suite v9.5 ‚Ä¢ 09/28/2017
  • IBM Certified Deployment Professional - Spectrum Protect V8.1 ‚Ä¢ 07/28/2017

entry.title: Macosapps
entry.content:
Awesome macOS (aka OS X)

A curated list of awesome applications, softwares, tools and shiny things for macOS.

Items marked with are open-source software and link to the source code. Items marked with are free (as in free beer).

Table of Contents

  • Applications
    • Audio
    • Backup
    • Chat Clients
    • Developers
    • E-Book Utilities
    • Editors
    • Email Utilities
    • Finder
    • Games
    • Graphics
    • Productivity
    • Sharing Files
    • Terminal
    • Utilities
    • Video
    • Window Management
    • Others
  • Command Line Utilities
  • macOS Utilities
  • Security

Applications

Audio

  • Audio Hijack - Record audio from any application like iTunes, Skype or Safari, or from hardware devices like microphones and mixers.
  • XLD - Rip/Decode/convert/play various ‚Äúlossless‚Äù audio files.

Backup

  • Carbon Copy Cloner - Create incremental and fully bootable backups of your Mac to external storage.

Bookmark Utilities

  • ReadKit - Have all your Instapaper, Pocket, etc. feeds in one place even when you‚Äôre offline.

Chat Clients

  • Telegram - A messaging app with a focus on speed and security, it‚Äôs super fast, simple and free.

Data Recovery

Developers

  • GitHub Desktop - A GUI for using GitHub.
  • GitUp - A simple but powerful Git

E-Book Utilities

  • Kindle App - Amazon Kindle App for macOS.

Editors

  • Sublime Text 3 - The sophisticated text editor.

Email Utilities

Finder

  • ForkLift - File Manager and FTP/SFTP/WebDAV/Amazon S3 client.

Games

  • Boxer - The DOS game emulator that‚Äôs fit for your Mac.
  • Dolphin - A powerful, Open Source emulator for Nintendo GameCube and Wii games.
  • OpenEmu - Multiple Video Game System.
  • Stockfish - Beautiful, powerful chess application.

Graphics

  • Acorn - A very Mac-like image editor with a comprehensive feature set.

Productivity

  • Alfred - Boosts your efficiency and productivity.

Sharing Files

  • Transmission - Simple, lightweight, multi-platform torrent client.

Terminal

  • iTerm 2 - A terminal emulator.

Utilities

  • 1Password - Password Manager and Secure Wallet.
  • CheatSheet - Know your short cuts.
  • Helium - A floating browser window that allows you to watch media while you work.
  • Monodraw - A powerful ASCII art editor.
  • Paparazzi - A small utility that makes screenshots of webpages.
  • Microsoft Remote Desktop Connection Client - Remote Desktop Connection Client lets you connect from your Macintosh computer to a Windows-based computer.
  • SSH Tunnel - Manage your SSH tunnels, tightly integrated with macOS Keychain, secure and intuitive.
  • TeamViewer - Remotely control another computer.
  • Ukelele - Unicode Keyboard Layout Editor.
  • The Unarchiver - Unarchive many different kinds of archive files.

Video

  • HandBrake - High performance video encoding and conversion tools with a nice GUI.
  • Subler - Mux and tag MP4 files.
  • Subtitlr - Drag and drop subititle download utility.

Window Management

Others

  • Aerial - Apple TV Aerial Screensaver for Mac.
  • Transmit - A FTP client.

Command Line Utilities

  • Awesome macOS Command Line - Use your macOS terminal shell to do awesome things.
  • m-cli - Ô£ø Swiss Army Knife for macOS.
  • Mac-CLI - Ô£ø macOS command line tools for developers.
  • Mac macOS Manual Pages - Apple‚Äôs official man page reference which lists all general commands in Section 1.
  • mas - A CLI for the Mac App Store.

macOS Utilities

Security

  • Tunnelblick - Easy to use OpenVPN client and GUI.

Miscellaneous

‚¨Ü back to top

License

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.

Apple macOS (aka OS X)

I use a lot of applications on our macs. Here is a list of the ones that I love and use the most of my day to day life, sorted by their importance:

  1. Alfred
    • this is by far my favourite application that I have. It saved me a lot of time in my life and has a really great community and very powerful workflows that you can use
    • I have attached the ones I use the most to this repo
    • feel free to use any that you like
  2. iTerm
    • recently moved completely to using the command line for all my development needs, this is probably the best terminal emulator out there that exists, have it assigned to w + j and can open it on demand at any time that I want
    • here are all the homebrew packages I like and use
    • I also really love using this workflow to quickly switch between iTerm tabs
  3. 1Password
    • my password manager of choice, recently started to generate all of my passwords with it and keep everything in a secured and encrypted vault kept secure by my one master password
    • no longer need to remember passwords and I now have a unique password for every website that I am signed up on whilist activating two factor authentication wherever possible
  4. Dictionary
    • comes natively with macOS and I started to love using it for exploring and searching through wikipedia
    • it is incredibly fast to make the searches and it also gives quick autosuggestions for any query I type that I can then select with up and down arrows
  5. Transmit
    • I often use this app to quickly send files from my local file system to the cloud (either S3 or dropbox) and get a shareable link I can send to people
    • I use this alfred workflow to quickly open the cloud storage I need
  6. Transmission
    • a torrent client that I use, very minimal in its UI but is very powerful and has all the features that I need without the bloat that uTorrent and other clients have
    • have all my torrents downloaded into their specific folders
    • I also want to set up a seedbox with my raspberry pie in the future as I have a bad tendency of not seeding the torrents that I downloaded
  7. Acorn
    • probably the best image editor out there on Mac, is packed with very powerful features and is very simple in its UI

Browser

My browser of choice is Safari. Chrome just kills the battery and Safari is really well optimised for macOS plus I have tried both and I really do find Safari a lot more ‚Äòsnappier‚Äô to use. One powerful plus that chrome does have over safari is the amount of chrome extensions that you can get. Fortunately the ones most needed for me do exist on Safari.

Extensions:

  1. Push to Kindle
  2. 1Password
  3. Synology Download Station extension

Command Line Apps

Homebrew is a really wonderful and user friendly package manager for macOS.

Here are all the packages I use from it.

And here are some more command line tools I use and love :

  • thefuck : corrects your previous console command
  • ccat : cat command with colours

Alfred Workflows

I find Alfred with its ability to create custom workflows for it to bring me the most value.

I keep a list of my favourite workflows and why I love them in a GitHub repository here. Feel free to contribute to it if you wish.

Awesome Mac

Note: This repository isn‚Äôt finished yet. It will be updated from time to time, stay tuned!

Table of Contents

  • Cloud Storages
  • Developer Tools
  • E-Mail
  • FTP Clients
  • Finance
  • Games
  • IDE (Integrated development environment)
  • Messaging
  • Organisational
  • Photo and Video
  • Music
  • Productivity
  • Utilities
  • Security
  • Text Editors

Cloud Storages

Several data providers who stores your data in the cloud

  • Google Drive - A file storage and synchronization service created by Google.
  • iCloud - A file storage and synchronization service powered by Apple.
  • OneDrive - OneDrive is a file hosting service that allows users to sync files and later access them from a web browser or mobile device from Microsoft.

Developer Tools

Several tools to support the work of a developer

  • Paw - The ultimative REST client for Mac.
  • Postman - Postman helps you develop APIs faster.
  • PSequel - A PostgreSQL GUI Tool for Mac OS X.
  • Sequel Pro - MySQL database management for Mac OS X.

E-Mail

Programs which are used to access and manage a user‚Äôs email

  • Airmail - Lightning Fast Mail Client for Mac and iPhone.
  • N1 - The extensible, open source mail client.
  • Postbox - Another powerful Mail Client for Mac.

FTP Clients

Applications to connect via several protocols to a server.

  • Cyberduck - Libre FTP, SFTP, WebDAV, S3 & OpenStack Swift client.
  • FileZilla - A fast and reliable cross-platform FTP, FTPS and SFTP client.
  • Flow - The Mac‚Äôs Best FTP + SFTP Client.
  • Transmit - The ultimate Mac OS X FTP + SFTP + S3 app.
  • Yummy FTP - Pro-level, Fast, Reliable FTP Client.

Finance

Applications to keep an eye on your costs

  • Banking 4 - Your banking software for OS X.

Games

A list of awesome games which are running smoothly under Mac OS X

  • Heroes of the Storm - A MOBA video game developed by Blizzard Entertainment.

IDE (Integrated development environment)

Software Applications that provides comprehensive facilities for software development.

  • Android Studio - Android Studio is the official integrated development environment (IDE) for Android platform development.
  • AppCode - Swift execution of your bright ideas.
  • CLion - intelligent cross-platform C/C++ IDE.
  • Eclipse - A project aiming to provide a universal toolset for development.
  • Intellij IDEA - The Most Intelligent Java IDE.
  • PhpStorm - The Most Intelligent PHP IDE.
  • PyCharm - The Most Intelligent Python IDE.
  • RubyMine - The Most Intelligent Ruby and Rails IDE.
  • WebStorm - The smartest JavaScript IDE.
  • VS Code - Excellent multipurpose IDE.

Messaging

Apps to communicate with other human beings

  • ChitChat - Unofficial Desktop client for WhatsApp.
  • Nimbus - Standalone IRCCloud client for OS X.
  • Skype - Share, message and call across Platforms.
  • Slack - A messaging app for teams.
  • Telegram - A new era of messaging.
  • Textual - The world‚Äôs most popular application for interacting with IRC on OS X.

Organisational

Apps to organize your life like calendars or task lists

  • Sunrise Calendar - A beautifully designed calendar experience for your Mac.

Photo and Video

Apps for you to be more creative

  • Zoommy - Find awesome free stock photos.

Music

Apps for listen to your favourite music

  • Soundnode - An opensource SoundCloud app for desktop.

Productivity

Apps to improve your productivity during your day

  • Cerebro - One-input productivity booster.
  • Wunderlist - Wunderlist is the easistest way to get stuff done. Keep your life in sync.

Utilities

A list of tools to ease up your work with Mac OS X

  • Alfred - Search your Mac and the web effortlessly, and control your Mac using customised actions with the Alfred.
  • Amphetamine - Don‚Äôt let you mac sleep.
  • Android File Transfer - Browse and transfer files upto 4 GB between Mac and Android device.
  • AppCleaner - A small application to thoroughly uninstall unwanted apps.
  • Battery Guardian - Battery Guardian offers an easy way to remember to deplete your MacBook battery. Depleting your battery helps extend the battery‚Äôs life.
  • CleanMyMac - CleanMyMac can helps you to clean your Mac, monitor its health, optimize it for speed, and more.
  • Fluid - Turn Your Favorite Web Apps into Real Mac Apps.
  • Garbage Truck - Automate emptying of trash on your Mac.
  • HyperDock - Windows 7 style preview of open windows/applications and more.
  • iTerm2 - A terminal emulator for Mac OS X that does amazing things.
  • Knock - Unlock your Mac faster and more securely than ever.
  • MacID - Unlock your Mac with just your fingerprint.‚Ñ¢
  • Onyx - The multifunction Utility.
  • Paste - Keep track of your clipboard.
  • Spectacle - Window control with simple and customizable keyboard shortcuts.
  • Kap - Kap. Capture your screen

Security

Encryption, Password Manager and other tools for your safety

  • 1Password - A comprehensive password manager.
  • Boxcryptor - A tool to encript your sensitive files in your cloud storage.
  • Dashlane - An another password manager & secure digital wallet.

Text Editors

A type of program used for editing plain text files.

  • Atom - A hackable text editor for the 21st Century.
  • BBEdit - It doesn‚Äôt suck.¬Æ
  • Coda2 - Your code for the web.
  • Emacs - Emacs is console based editor and highly customizable.
  • Sublime Text 3 - A sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose.
  • TextMate - The Missing Editor for Mac OS X.
  • Vim - Vim is a highly configurable console based editor aimed at efficient text creation and modification.

Authors

Philipp Br√§utigam

  • github/xyNNN
  • twitter/pbraeutigam

‚Ä¶ and Contributors!

License

To the extent possible under law, Philipp Br√§utigam has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this work.
